sen.j: 勅旨所（ちょくししょ）とは、延暦元年（782年）に廃止された勅旨省の継承機関。
sen.e: Chokushisho was the organization that succeeded Chokushisho (Bureau of Edicts) abolished in 782.

sen.j: 勅旨省と同様に天皇のための物資調達と家産経営にあたったと考えられている。
sen.e: As with Chokushisho, it was in charge of commodity procurement and asset management of the Imperial family.

sen.cmt: 勅旨省と勅旨所が同じ読みなので、識別のため補足を付けました。

sen.j: その実態を示す史料は少ないが、延暦8年（799年）に勅旨所から東大寺三綱に宛てられた文書の草案が「平安遺文」中に収録されている。
sen.e: Though few historical materials that recorded its reality are existent, a draft document sent by Chokushisho in 799 to Todai-ji Temple's sango (a monk with managerial role) was compiled in "Heian Ibun".

sen.j: その中には長官紀古佐美・次官藤原内麻呂以下勅旨所の諸役人の署判が記されている。
sen.e: In this document, seals of Chokushisho's officials, including its director KI no Kosami and assistant director FUJIWARA no Uchimaro, are seen.

sen.e: Provided, however, that all of officials other than the director and assistant director were those of Kuraryo (Bureau of Palace Storehouses) and from this fact, it is believed that Chokushisho had already been absorbed by Kuraryo in effect by that time.
